body:
After some analysis, I'm pretty sure this will cause problem:

1. the plugin factory is a global instance
2. it is linked here by trt_shape_function, which will eventually be linked into python/ops/_trt_engine_op.so which will be loaded by the python library
3. it is also linked into trt_engine_op_kernel and trt_conversion, which will eventually linked into _wrap_conversion.so which will be loaded by the python library
4. so there will be two copies of the factory, which is dangerous and will cause problems

I would suggest to make a header-only library and let trt_shape_function depend on it instead. The Logger class in the trt_logging rule also has this problem, but since it doesn't contain any data, it should be fine (but I still want to fix it later).
